meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>return</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to return</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to be returned</vocabulary>. This is when something does this on its own. You aren't doing the returning of something in this case.
readingMnemonic: The reading is the same as the one you learned with the kanji.
